questions.text: A diabetic man takes his insulin bolus and then takes his meal. This would cause activation of all of the following enzymes, except:

A 4-year-old boy presents with a rash on his face and neck and a history of ataxia and diarrhea. His urine shows the presence of neutral amino acids. Supplementation of which of the following would help alleviate this boy's symptoms?
In what sequence do muscles develop rigor mortis, progressing from early to late?

options.label: A
options.text: Orbicularis oculi, neck, face, thorax, upper limb

options.label: B
options.text: Orbicularis oculi, neck, facial muscles, upper limb, thorax

options.label: C
options.text: Neck, muscles of eyelid, upper limb, thorax

options.label: D
options.text: Neck, muscles of eyelid, facial muscles, thorax, upper limb

questions.correct_answer: A. Orbicularis oculi, neck, face, thorax, upper limb
questions.explanation: Ans. A) Orbicularis oculi, facial muscles, thorax, upper limb

questions.explanation: Ans. A) The maximum buffering capacity of the compound is represented by points A and B

questions.text: Identify the correct statements: Spermatozoa remain motile in the vagina for 6-8 hours Nonmotile forms can be detected till 72 hours. P30 is used as a screening test, detectable in vaginal fluid for about 24 hours Toluidine blue stain is used to detect microinjuries in the victim
Increasing which of the following substances in his diet is most likely to help a patient with PDH deficiency generate energy without further elevating lactate levels?
2,3 BPG causes unloading of oxygen to tissues because:

options.label: A
options.text: It decreases ATP production and hence breaks the links between globin chains

options.label: C
options.text: Binds to the central cavity of hemoglobin surrounded by histidine and lysine and favours salt bridge formation

questions.correct_answer: C. Binds to the central cavity of hemoglobin surrounded by histidine and lysine and favours salt bridge formation
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Binds to the central cavity of hemoglobin surrounded by histidine and lysine and favors salt bridge formation:

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective
  • ➤ 2,3 BPG is formed in RL shunt which has no net ATP production 2,3 BPG has negative charge whereas beta chain of hemoglobin has large negative charges due to amino acids His and Lys. Together they form the salt bridges (see fig) which promote formation of taut conformation and helps in deoxygenation.
  • ➤ 2,3 BPG is formed in RL shunt which has no net ATP production
  • ➤ 2,3 BPG has negative charge whereas beta chain of hemoglobin has large negative charges due to amino acids His and Lys. Together they form the salt bridges (see fig) which promote formation of taut conformation and helps in deoxygenation.
  • ➤ When 2,3 BPG levels gets decreased, it promotes relaxed confirmation of Hb resulting in oxygen loading.
  • ➤ When 2,3 BPG levels gets decreased, it promotes relaxed confirmation of Hb resulting in oxygen loading.

Succinate dehydrogenase (SDH) is an enzyme complex located within the inner mitochondrial membrane that catalyses the oxidation of succinate to fumarate. An experiment is conducted to determine if malate alters the rate of SDH activity. Reaction velocity is measured with and without a fixed quantity of malate as succinate concentration is gradually increased. Which of the following is the most accurate statement about malate in this experiment?

options.label: A
options.text: It alters the maximal velocity of the reaction

options.label: B
options.text: It binds the enzyme at a different site than succinate

options.label: C
options.text: It decreases affinity of the enzyme for succinate

options.label: D
options.text: It is a competitive inhibitor of the enzyme

questions.correct_answer: D. It is a competitive inhibitor of the enzyme
questions.explanation: Ans. D) It is a competitive inhibitor of the enzyme

A 32-year-old previously healthy man comes to the emergency department due to a 3-hour history of chest pain, diaphoresis, and dyspnea. He does not smoke, exercises regularly, and eats a balanced diet. His father died at age 56 from a myocardial infarction. His blood pressure is 110/70 mm Hg and pulse is 110/min and regular. ECG shows ST elevation in the anterolateral leads. Coronary angiogram reveals proximal left anterior descending artery stenosis and thrombosis, which is treated with angioplasty and stent placement. Laboratory results are as follows: Total cholesterol: 160 mg/dL Low-density lipoprotein: 90 mg/dL Glucose, serum: 98 mg/dL Homocysteine, plasma: 21.5 µmol/L (normal: 4-14 µmol/L) Further testing reveals a homozygous mutation in the methylene tetrahydrofolate reductase gene that leads to decreased enzymatic activity.
